description: One gender is considered subservient
or inferior to the other.
Culture is heavily influenced by a religion
or belif systems, possibly one unique to
this world.
Art and culture are highly prized.
Aesthetic design is important in all artefacts
produced on this world.
Social interaction and trade is highly formalised.
Politeness and adherence to traditional forms is
considered very important.
The culture resist change and outside influence
The culture distrust outsiders and alien influences.
Offworlders will face considerable prejudice
A particular topic is forbidden and cannot
be discussed. Travellers who unwittingly mention
this topic will be ostracized
Trickery and equivocation are considered
acceptable. Honesty is a sign of weakness.
The culture welcomes change and offworld
influence. Travellers who bring new and
strange ideas will be welcomed.
One's word is one's bond in the culture.
Lying is both rare and despised
The culture is heavily influenced by another,
neighbouring world. Roll again for a cultural
quirk that has been inherited from the culture
The culture is a merger of two distinct cultures.
Roll again twice to determine the quirks inherited
from these cultures. If the quirks are incompatible
then the culture is likely divided.
Physical strength and combat prowess are highly
valued in the culture. Travellers may be
challenged to a fight, or dismissed if they seem
incapable of defending themselves. Sports tend
towards the bloody and violent.
The culture is a surviving remenant of a
once-great and vibrant civilisation, clining
to its former glory. The world is filled
with crumbling ruins, and every story
revolves around the good old days.
The culture is falling apart and is on the
brink of war or economic collapse. Violent
protests are common, and the social order
is decaying.
The culture is expanding and vibrant. Fortunes
are being made in trade and science is forging
bravely ahead.
A recent trauma, such as a plague, war, disaster
or despotic regime has left scars on the culture
Members of many different cultures and species visit here
Some aspect of the culture or the planet draws
visitors from all over charted space.
Physical conflict is common, taking the form
of duels, brawls or other contests. Trial by combat
is a part of the judicual system.
Physical conflict is almost unheared of. The culture
produces few soldiers, and diplomacy reigns supreme.
Forcefull Travellers will be ostracised.
Everyone is obsessed with or addicted to a substance,
personality, act or item. This monomania pervades every
aspect of the culture.
Fine clothing and decoration are considered vitally
important in the culture. Underdressed Travellers
will have no standing here.
The culture is at war, either with another planet
or polity, or is troubled by terrorists or rebels
Unusual Custom: Space travellers hold a uniqe
position in the culture's mythology or beliefs,
and Travellers will be expected to live up to
these myths.
Unusual Custom: The planet's starport is more
than a commvercial centre. It might be a
religious temple, or be seen as highly
controversial and surrounded by protestors
Unusual Custom: News agencies and telecommunications
channels are especially strange here. Getting
accurate information may be difficult.
Unusual Custom: The culture interacts with
technology in an unusual way. Telecommunications
might be banned, robots might have civil rights
or cyborgs might be property.
Unusual Custom: There might be a mandatory age
of termination, or anagathics might be widely
used. Family units might be different, with
children being raised bu the state or banned
in favor of cloning.
Unusual Custom: The culture has a distinct
caste system. Travellers of a low social
standing who do not behave approproately
will face punishment.
Unusual Custom: The culture has an odd
attitude towards some aspect of commerce,
which may interfere with trade at the
spaceport. For example, merchants might
expect a gift as part of a deal, or some
goods may only be handled by certain families.
Unusual Custom: Those of high social standing
have a strange custom associated wuth them.
Perhaps nobles are blinded, or must live in
gilded cages, or only serve for a single year
before being exiled.
Unusual Custom: The culture has an unusual
attitude towards intercourse and reproduction.
Perhaps cloning is used instead, or sex is
used to seal commercial deals.
Unusual Custom: Food and drink occupies an
unusual place in the culture. Perhaps earing
is a private affair, or banquets and formal
dinners are seen as the highest form of politness.
Unusual Custom: Travellers may be distrusted
or feted, or perhaps the culture frowns on
those who leave their homes.
Unusual Custom: Something strange is going on.
The government is being subverted by another
group or agency
